result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
**defendant refused to sign**
Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property. 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Pick up personal belongings with police escort. 
Comply with day reporting requirements  - Monitor alcohol device TBD by the day report staff & GPS

11:03 AM Defendant Joseph D Stolper appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Zachary Derksen appeared by video for Joseph D Stolper.  Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of rights. Received complaint/waived reading. NG Plea entered.950/Marsy's Law complied with. Probable cause found in the complaint. Bond set.
